name: SQL script 8 explore trip data  green parquet

content.query:
USE nyc_taxi_discovery

SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_parquet/year=2020/month=01/',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_raw'
    ) AS [result]

-- Identify the interred data type
EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set N'
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''trip_data_green_parquet/year=2020/month=01/'',
        FORMAT = ''PARQUET'',
        DATA_SOURCE = ''nyc_taxi_raw''
    ) AS [result]'

-- Change Data type 
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_parquet/year=2020/month=01/',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_raw'
    ) WITH(
        VendorID INT,
        lpep_pickup_datetime datetime2(7),
        lpep_dropoff_datetime datetime2(7),
        store_and_fwd_flag CHAR(1),
        RatecodeID INT,
        PULocationID INT,
        DOLocationID INT,
        passenger_count INT,
        trip_distance FLOAT,
        fare_amount FLOAT,
        extra FLOAT,
        mta_tax FLOAT,
        tip_amount FLOAT,
        tolls_amount FLOAT,
        ehail_fee INT,
        improvement_surcharge FLOAT,
        total_amount FLOAT,
        payment_type INT,
        trip_type INT,
        congestion_surcharge FLOAT
    )AS [result];

-- Parquet is columnar format - that can reduce the data scanned time
-- it can go directly to sprcified column
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_parquet/year=2020/month=01/',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_raw'
    ) WITH(
        fare_amount FLOAT,
        trip_type INT
    )AS [result];

/* Assignment
------------- 
1) query from folders using wildcard characters
2) use filename function
3) query from sub folder
4) use filepath function to select only certain partitions

*/


-- 1) query from folders using wildcard characters
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_parquet/year=*/month=*/*.parquet',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_raw'
    ) AS [trip_data]

-- 2) use filename function

SELECT
    TOP 100
    trip_data.filename() AS file_name,
    trip_data.*
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_parquet/year=*/month=*/*.parquet',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_raw'
    ) AS [trip_data]

-- 3) query from sub folder
SELECT
    TOP 100
    trip_data.filepath() AS file_path,
    trip_data.*
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_parquet/**',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_raw'
    ) AS [trip_data]

-- 4) use filepath function to select only certain partitions
SELECT
    trip_data.filepath(1) AS year,
    trip_data.filepath(2) AS month,
    COUNT(1) AS record_count
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_parquet/year=*/month=*/*.parquet',
        FORMAT = 'PARQUET',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_raw'
    ) AS [trip_data]
WHERE trip_data.filepath(1) = '2020'
    AND trip_data.filepath(2) IN ('03','04','05')
GROUP BY trip_data.filepath(1), trip_data.filepath(2)
ORDER BY trip_data.filepath(1), trip_data.filepath(2);
